description: Early Roman settlement, probably military settlement which was abandoned by mid 2nd CE, followed by subsequent religious use. Later use dated to the 3rd CE shows a square masonry building with a circular inner chamber, with a central posthole. Interpreted as a shrine or mausoleum.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “The Prospect, Ross-on-Wye (Herefordshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Priestley, and Wellicome. “Archaeological Excavation and Evaluation The Propsect, Ross-on-Wye, Herefordshire,” 2011. https://doi.org/10.5284/1026983.
